result.execSummary:
The defendant Kathryn Jane Lindau was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kathryn Jane Lindau is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kathryn Jane Lindau was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kathryn Jane Lindau

records.addlTxt: Order to Stipulation. km          to SRN on 5/4
Plea and Order. Signed by Atty Lundeen and ADA Smestad. km

01:20 PM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, ADA:  Brian Thomas Smestad via zoom, DF ATTY: Barry Curtis Lundeen, DF: Kathryn Jane Lindau appeared.  Atty. Lundeen states counsel has reached an agreement and asks to set out matter. Court will schedule internal review. Bond Continues. Adjourned 1:25 PM. bph
for Discovery and Demand for Discovery. Filed by Atty Lundeen. km
Cover Letter for NOR. Filed by Atty B. Lundeen. km

Adjustment Number: 22A 010759,
Payable Number: 237377,
Receipt Number: 22R 001255,
Amount: $20.00
Pre-trial conference on March 1, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

$250 bond on file.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, J.W.S.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

02:42 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: Melstrom, Clerk: Lindabaur. ADA: Bela Alexander Ballo DF ATTY: Jeremiah Harrelson and Kaitlin Dippolito for today    Katherine Jane Lindau appeared. Defendant doesn't qualify for PD- PFAC given.  DE confirms address and DOB. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waive reading. NG. Bond argument; bond ordered. Waive speedy trial. Court sets PTC. Adjourned at 2:45 PM.  gll  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 1, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
